snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry met with Palestinian and Israeli leaders and called efforts to restart peace talks “very positive discussions.”
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry leaves Israel after four days of most intense Middle East peace push in years without securing public commitment from Israel or Palestinians that they will return to negotiating table; Kerry promises to return to region soon.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren reported from Jerusalem, and Michael R. Gordon from Tel Aviv. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry met with Palestinian and Israeli leaders and called efforts to restart peace talks “very positive discussions.”

headline.main:
Kerry Sees Progress
in Effort to Revive
Mideast Talks
headline.print_headline: No Promises, but Kerry Is Optimistic on Mideast Talks
